title: How Neural Networks Learn Through Backpropagation
topic_summary: An introduction to backpropagation - the fundamental algorithm that enables neural networks to learn by adjusting connection weights based on prediction errors
target_audience: Tech-curious adults with no machine learning background

scenes.title: Introduction
scenes.narration_summary: Hook question about recognizing cats, introducing the puzzle of learning without explicit programming

scenes.title: Neural Network Basics
scenes.narration_summary: Explaining layers, nodes, and weights as the fundamental building blocks

scenes.title: Forward Pass
scenes.narration_summary: Showing how input flows through layers, weights combine, and prediction emerges

scenes.title: Backpropagation
scenes.narration_summary: Error calculation and working backwards to adjust weights proportionally

scenes.title: Key Insight
scenes.narration_summary: The network discovers patterns through thousands of examples, not explicit programming
